q: For some people, it also carries anti-Semitic overtones. But a Chrysler spokesman, Gualberto Ranieri, told DealBook in a telephone interview on Friday that Mr. Sergio Marchionne harbored no ill intent in using that word. I'm 110 percent sure that in absolutely no possible way was this meant to be anti-Semitic, Mr. Ranieri said. "The meaning was that the rates were so high, they were really extraordinary." Mr. Sergio Marchionne 's right in that Chrysler has borne a heavy burden from those loans. It

Barack Obama said Egypt is making progress toward a solution to the political crisis enveloping the country and preparing for free elections to replace Hosni Mubarak . Obviously, Egypt has to negotiate a path, and I think they're making progress. Barack Obama told reporters. The heavily guarded and shuttered Egyptian Museum in Cairo is next to Tahrir Square, a protest encampment that draws hundreds of thousands of people on some days. We will open the museum after the strike is finished. I don't know when the strike is finished, said Antiquities Minister Zahi Hawass , referring to the upheaval. But as she remained almost omnipresent, she has won a lot of people over, because she's been there, and she's been there over and over again. him credit for." Though Dermot O'Leary admits he enjoys working with Simon Cowell , he and the rest of the people who work with the music mogul hate to let him down. He added: Don't get me wrong, he's still my boss, but he's sort of a Victorian father- you'd hate to let him down. On the occasion that happens I literally feel sick. While Dermot O'Leary would love to continue working with Simon Cowell by taking a role on the US' X Factor' he is trying not to worry about it.
